alert.note: Alert for Juneau (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued March 25 at 6:21PM CDT until March 28 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...The Flood Watch is replaced with a River Flood Warning for the following rivers in Wisconsin... Black River Near Galesville affecting Trempealeau and La Crosse zones. ...The Flood Watch continues for the following rivers in Wisconsin... Yellow River at Necedah affecting Juneau County. For the Black River...including Neillsville, Black River Falls, Galesville...flooding is possible. For the Yellow River...including Necedah...flooding is possible. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE SATURDAY NIGHT TO MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Yellow River at Necedah. * WHEN...From late Saturday night to Monday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:00 PM CDT Friday the stage was 12.9 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached early Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. Additional river and weather information is available at www.weather.gov/lacrosse. The next statement will be issued this evening at 730 PM CDT.
